title: Orhan Kaynak
text:
Orhan Kaynak (born 1 March 1970 in <a href="Adana">Adana</a>), also known as Küçük Orhan, is a retired <a href="Turkey">Turkish</a> <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> best known for his stints in the Turkish <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a> with <a href="Adanaspor">Adanaspor</a>, <a href="Trabzonspor">Trabzonspor</a>, and <a href="Kocaelispor">Kocaelispor</a>.
Professional career.
Orhan followed his brothers and graduated from the <a href="Adanaspor">Adanaspor</a> and joined the first team in the <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a>. He spent the rest of his career in the highest divisions of Turkey, with notable performances with Trabzonspor and Kocaelispor.
Coaching career.
On 2 March 2018, Kaynak was appointed as the manager of <a href="Sar%C4%B1yer%20S.K.">Sarıyer</a>. Kaynak won two games out of ten at <a href="Sar%C4%B1yer%20S.K.">Sarıyer</a>. On 12 June 2018, Kaynak was linked with a move to <a href="Elaz%C4%B1%C4%9Fspor">Elazığspor</a>. Later on the month, he was officially announced as the club's new manager. After seven months, on 24 January 2019, Kaynak decided to resign from <a href="Elaz%C4%B1%C4%9Fspor">Elazığspor</a>. The club was in a very bad economical condition and had a debt of 46 million <a href="turkish%20lira">turkish lira</a>, also with 12 players leaving the club. 
A few days later, on 28 January 2019, Kaynak was announced as the new manager of <a href="Boluspor">Boluspor</a>.
Personal life.
Orhan was born in to a large family of 8 children. His brothers <a href="Re%C5%9Fit%20Kaynak">Reşit</a>, <a href="Kayhan%20Kaynak">Kayhan</a>, <a href="%C4%B0rfan%20Kaynak">İrfan</a>, <a href="%C4%B0lhan%20Kaynak">İlhan</a> and <a href="Ayhan%20Kaynak">Ayhan</a> were all professional footballers. He earned the nickname "Küçük Orhan" (meaning little Orhan), because <a href="Orhan%20%C3%87%C4%B1k%C4%B1r%C4%B1k%C3%A7%C4%B1">Orhan Çıkırıkçı</a> was in the same team at <a href="Trabzonspor">Trabzonspor</a>.
